text: [Music]
I'm Holden currently I work at Netflix I
also do like a whole bunch of side
projects and I work on a bunch of
different open source data things I
really like Rey and Spark and dask and
just all sorts of fun things in the in
the data space one of the things that
really excited me when I first saw Ray
was the actor model and how we could use
that to handle state in a distributed
fashion a lot better than what we had
been trying to do in spark and so that
was like really appealing and so the the
ability to make better ml models and
better support our friends in the
machine learning space was something
that really excited me about coming to
Ray for our workflows I think some of
the key places where Rey is really
better than a lot of the other options
um there is the actor model for doing
our distributed State there's also the
ray data sets and sort of the shared
memory model that Ray has that is
something that the other tools just
don't quite have down as well this is
very useful because all of the tools are
able to interoperate but the shared
memory structure means that we don't
have to depend on things like the disk
cache hitting
um like the same way we do with some of
the other tools also I mean also the
general ecosystem is is really Pleasant
the python data ecosystem is just so
much more rich and vibrant that it's a
lot easier for our partners in data
science to find the tools that they need
to use to be successful some of the main
benefits that using Ray provides is
there's the reduced computation time
right and that's really important when
you're running at really big scales
because training these models is
incredibly expensive even just doing the
data preparation can be pretty expensive
so there's sort of like a reduced cost
aspect of it there's also the more
ability to I would say experiment and
innovate and I think that's super
important because often we don't know
what it is is going to be the best
solution and so being able to provide
that flexibility to our users to
prototype quickly is super important for
them to be able to come up with the best
possible solutions to these problems so
some of the magic moments using Rey the
deployment of the actor model on on
kubernetes was just like oh my God this
is so much easier I don't have to think
about where these things are scheduled
Rey makes it so that you don't have to
tear your hair out and you can you can
actually just focus on doing the things
that you enjoy not staring at a
requirements file trying to figure out
how these things all fit together
foreign
